mechanics.condition: Target a flat solid surface within range
mechanics.outcome: A shadowy door is created on the surface; The door is large enough for Medium creatures to pass unhindered

mechanics.condition: Caster chooses to create a new demiplane
mechanics.outcome: The door leads to an empty 30-foot cube demiplane; The demiplane's walls appear to be wood or stone

mechanics.condition: Caster has previously created a demiplane with this spell
mechanics.outcome: Caster can choose to connect the shadowy door to an owned previously created demiplane

mechanics.condition: Caster knows the nature and contents of a demiplane created by another creature's Demiplane spell
mechanics.outcome: Caster can choose to connect the shadowy door to that other creature's demiplane

mechanics.condition: Any creatures or objects are inside the demiplane
mechanics.outcome: The shadowy door disappears (both sides); Creatures and objects inside the demiplane become trapped there

description_text: You create a shadowy door on a flat solid surface that you can see within range. The door is large enough to allow Medium creatures to pass through unhindered. When opened, the door leads to a demiplane that appears to be an empty room 30 feet in each dimension, made of wood or stone. When the spell ends, the door disappears, and any creatures or objects inside the demiplane remain trapped there, as the door also disappears from the other side. Each time you cast this spell, you can create a new demiplane, or have the shadowy door connect to a demiplane you created with a previous casting of this spell. Additionally, if you know the nature and contents of a demiplane created by a casting of this spell by another creature, you can have the shadowy door connect to its demiplane instead.
